attributes.action: revive the Bullock Committee  Report of 1978 and take steps to legislate for the appointment of worker directors to the Boards of the major banks
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Reflecting upon the difficulties which we are having in persuading banks to act in a socially responsible manner I do think that it might be time to wipe the dust off the Bullock Committee Report on Industrial Democracy which was published in 1978
 
This recommended the appointment of worker directors to the Board of their own companies These directors were to be elected by their fellow workers.It followed the German system of Co-Determination which was imposed by the Allies after the Second World War and which was extended to all companies in 1974
 
This system has been very successful in two respects important to us at this time
 
Firstly,it made directors and workers cooperate in the running of companies for socially responsible aims and not just for maximum profit
 
Secondly,it helped curb directors'salaries and bonuses.Worker directors were required to be paid at their normal shop floor rate

Surely this idea's time has arrived
